## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r cars}
summary(cars)
```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
plot(pressure)
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.


```{r}
##Q-Q Plot Bagged
library(ggpubr)
ggqqplot(bagged)
##Shapiro-Wilk normality test Bagged
shapiro.test(bagged)
```


```{r}
##Q-Q Plot Unbagged
library(ggpubr)
ggqqplot(unbagged)
##Shapiro-Wilk normality test Unbagged
shapiro.test(unbagged)
```


```{r}
# Data in two numeric vectors
# ++++++++++++++++++++++++++
# Microplastics in Bagged Lettuce
bagged <-c(57.500, 41.625, 35.625, 30.000, 33.750)
# Microplastics in Unbagged Lettuce
unbagged <-c(21.625, 37.125, 33.875, 37.5000, 33.750)
# Create a data frame
bagged_unbagged <- data.frame(group = rep(c("bagged", "unbagged"), each = 5), microplastics = c(bagged,  unbagged))
```

```{r}
##Paired Samples Wilcoxon Test and T-Test Bagged/Unbagged
library("dplyr")
group_by(bagged_unbagged, group) %>%
  summarise(
    count = n(),
    median = median(microplastics, na.rm = TRUE),
    IQR = IQR(microplastics, na.rm = TRUE))

library("ggpubr")
ggboxplot(bagged_unbagged, x = "group", y = "microplastics", 
          color = "group", palette = c("#00AFBB", "#E7B800"),
          order = c("bagged", "unbagged"),
          ylab = "# Microplastics", xlab = "Groups")

wilcox.test(microplastics ~ group, data = bagged_unbagged, paired = TRUE)

t.test(bagged, unbagged, var.equal = TRUE)
```
